column1: The sparrow looks saucily at him
column5: Sir Hawk! You have scared me many a time with your sharp claws and hooked beak; but now I am a match for you. It was fine fun for you to kill little chickens. Now you see what comes of it.""Yes indeed
column6: cries the turkey, he killed seven dear little chickens. How glad I am that he is caught at last! I'll give him a piece of my mind now
column7: but he can't have any more chickens.""Ah!" says the hawk
column9: if I were let out of this cage
column10: you would not stare at me much longer."The fowls walk slowly away without saying more. But the pert young sparrow bristles up
column11: and dares the hawk to come out and fight him. It is very easy to be brave when there is no danger.
